Creating and Managing Knowledge Bases

07 Jun 2022 - 1 minute to read
A knowledge base is a set of multi-indexed documents. Thanks to Altilia Knowledge Base™ it’s possible to create them and for each document a series of indexes can be defined using metadata and annotations. In particular, metadata can be assigned during the intake of documents into the knowledge base, while annotations are assigned through the use of Altilia Labels described in the chapter Creating Configuring Curating and Managing Dataset. All assigned labels can be considered as document metadata. In this way, documents are transformed into structured data that can then be queried.
    1. You can recognize that you are in the Knowledge Base view and in which of them you are working, by the indication provided in the header at the top left of the screen:

Before you Start

Not sure what file format types you can intake in the knowledge base? Start with our Intake File Type article to discover about it before building the knowledge base. Also, make sure you:
    1. are logged into the platform, otherwise read chapter Account Setup with Altilia Intelligent Automation™ first;
    2. have created a Project as described in the chapter Creating and Managing Project.

Create Knowledge Base

    1. In the Altilia Intelligent Automation™ app, click "Knowledge Bases" on the left navigation bar. The Knowledge Bases Module opens.
    2. Create a new knowledge base by clicking on "+ New New Knowledge Base":
    1. Type name and description (optional) of your knowledge base and then click on “Save” on the right panel that appears to you:
    1. Your knowledge base is now saved. At the same time a pop-up message is displayed on the screen asking you if you want immediately to be redirected to the settings page of the newly created knowledge base to intake documents and add metadata as described rispectly in the paragraph Intake Documents into Knowledge Base and Adding Metadata while Intaking Documents. In this case click on “Yes” otherwise you can postpone it to a later time (by clicking “No”) following the paragraph Access into Knowledge Base.

Knowledge Base Information

Your Knowledge Bases are available in the Knowledge Bases Artifact of your Project, you can use the sorting and searching functionality to find it as described in the paragraph Sorting and Search Knowledge Base:
    1. Inside a Knowledge Base panel, several information regarding the created Knowledge Base are shown. From the top to the bottom at the left side of the panel you can find:
      • Project Name: also clickable to edit it as described in Edit Knowledge Base,
      • Author: username of the owner,
      • Last modified: date of the last changes.
    2. Also within the Knowledge Base panel, you can also find other two features at the upper right corner side, read also more about them in the paragraph Settings Knowledge Bases:
      • Quick button: interchangeable button with other functions that you can set,
      • Three dots: to access, delete and archive the Connector

Intake Documents into Knowledge Base

    1. In the Knowledge Bases Module, access to the settings of your knowledge base already created by clicking the three dots icon in the upper right corner and then on “Go to kbs”:
    1. In the Preview Section you can see all the files uploaded to the selected knowledge base. When there are no documents, the “Intake documents” button is shown at the center of the page. Click on it to be redirected to the Intake Section, otherwise move on it by clicking on “Intake” at the top left of the current view.
    1. In the Intake Section, select “Local Upload” on the left Files panel to indicate the local PC as file upload source.
    1. Click on “Browse Files” to add files from local or drag and drop them to the space indicated on the left Files panel and select the files you want to intake.
    1. Now, the selected documents are shown in the Files panel, so click “Upload” at the bottom right of the same panel to start the ingestion process which you can follow from the Processing status bar as described in the paragraph Follow Intaking Process. In case you want to delete all the files that were ready to be processed, then click on “Reset” instead next to the uploading button. Here, you may also add metadata at this stage before intake of the documents as reported in the next paragraph Adding Metadata while Intaking Documents. If you are experiencing problems in the ingestion take a look at the Common Challenges and Resolutions on Knowledge Base paragraph or contact us as described in Altilia Resource Center chapter.
    1. To review the ingested files go back in the Preview Section, the documents are shown now as described in the paragraph Knowledge Base Preview Section. Your knowledge base is completed. In any case, you can update your knowledge base at any time, adding other documents as described above or deleting them following the paragraph Delete Documents from Knowledge Base.

Adding Metadata while Intaking Documents

As mentioned in the previous paragraph Intake Documents into Knowledge Base, it’s possible to index by using metadata during the intake phase.
    1. In the Intake Section of the Knowledge Base Module, type key and value and then click on “add” on the Files Metadata pannel:
    1. Click “Upload” when you finish to add all metadata:
    1. Going back to the Preview Section the metadata are displayed in the documents list:

Intake File Type

In the Intake Section of the Knowledge Base Module, during the ingestion stage, select pdf files as platform supported format (for now):

Follow Intaking Process

In the Intake Section of the Knowledge Bases Module follow the ingestion process by the Processing status bar at the bottom of the Files panel. As soon as you click on “Upload” the process starts and the ongoing progress is highlighted by a loading percentage bar. When completed, the uploaded files disappear and the phrase "All files have been uploaded" appears in their place:
See also the “Import details” by clicking on the info button where several useful numericals of the ongoing process are shown:

Altilia Searches

The Altilia Searches™ is a complete search engine that enables full text searches on the documents. It’s possible to use search by keyword, key phrase and regular expression combined using all the typical logical operators.
    1. In the Knowledge Bases Module, open Altilia Searches by clicking on the three dots icon in the upper right corner of desidered Knowledge Base panel and then on “Search”:
    1. It’s also reachable by clicking the “Search” button on top right of the screen of the Preview or Intake Section:
    1. Altilia Searches opens, use it to inspect the documents content of the selected knowledge base:

Easy Search

    1. Type the word you want to search, all the occurrences found in the knowledge base documents are shown in a snippet for each of it.
    1. It’s possible to visualize the searched string inside the original document by clicking on the highlighted word of the interested snippet. A useful edge shows the position of the word in the document for fast inspection:

Advanced Search

Powerful advanced search allows to use regular expressions.
    1. Click on “Advanced Search” at the top right of the screen to use this kind of search
    1. Tick the checkbox “Regular expression” to able it and type your regular expression to find all occurrences:

Search Filter

In Altilia Searches on the left panel, useful filters are also provided. There’re several filter types:

Settings Knowledge Bases

    1. In the Knowledge Bases Artifact, set the quick button of your Knowledge Bases panel so that the most frequently used icon appears to you by clicking the three dots icon in the upper right corner of each Knowledge Bases panel.
    1. Pin the desidered icon in order to see it next to the left of the three dots icon. By default it’s set to “Go to kbs”, read more about it on the paragraph Access into Knowledge Base.
    1. Click the pin icon to the right of “Archive” to set it as a quick button for each Knowledge Bases, read more about it on the paragraph Archive and Unarchive Knowledge Bases
    1. Click the pin icon to the right of “Delete” to set it as a quick button for each Knowledge Bases, read more about it on the paragraph Delete Knowledge Bases.
    1. Click the pin icon to the right of “Searches” to set it as a quick button for each Knowledge Bases, read more about it on the paragraph Altilia Searches.

Edit Knowledge Base

    1. In the Knowledge Base Module, edit your Knowledge Base already created by clicking on the name at the top left of its panel:
    1. The drawer panel opens at the right of the screen enabling you to change name and description of the Knowledge Base:
    1. Overwrite them and click anywhere on the screen outside the drawer panel to apply the changes. A pop-up message is displayed as confirmation:

Knowledge Base Drawer Functionality

From the following drawer it’s also possible to use some features designed to speed up the navigation in the platform.
    1. Access in a Knowledge Base by clicking on the “Details” button on the bottom side of the drawer panel:
    1. Archive a Knowledge Base by clicking on the “Archive” button on the bottom side of the drawer panel
    1. Remove a Knowledge Base by clicking on the “Delete” button on the bottom side of the drawer panel:

Access into Knowledge Base

    1. In the Knowledge Base Artifact, access your Knowledge Base already created by clicking on the three dots icon in the upper right corner of desidered Knowledge Base panel and then on “Go to kbs”:
    1. The page you are redirected to is the Overview Section which is described in paragraph Knowledge Base Overview Section
It’s also possible to access a Knowledge Base by quick button as described in paragraphs Settings Knowledge Base or from the drawer panel as shown in Knowledge Base Drawer Functionality.

Knowledge Base Preview Section

In the Preview Section of Knowledge Bases Artifact, review the documents intaked in the selected Knowledge Base in a tabular format. Various features are usable and configurable here:

Documents Table

    1. From the first to last column of the documents table you can see:
        1. Document - the name of the documents;
        2. Status - the state in which the document can be found, if ingested correctly then “ingested” is displayed;
        3. Size - the file size in kilobyte
    1. Select the columns you want see by clicking on the settings icon at the upper right corner, then check the desired columns and click on “Apply”.

Documents Table Settings

    1. Sort the list of documents by name by clicking the arrow at the upper left corner of the table:
    1. Increase the number of documents displayed in the table if you need, by clicking on the page number at the bottom of the table and selecting between 10, 20 or 50:
    1. Change the table page view by clicking the left or right arrow at the middle bottom of the table:

Delete Documents from Knowledge Base

    1. Delete a single file at ones by clicking the trash icon at the right of each row of the table (a pop-up message will ask you double confirm):
    1. Delete more files at once by selecting the checkbox at the bottom left corner of the table (the number of selected files are shown on the bottom left) and then clicking on “delete” button (a pop-up message will ask you double confirm):

Archive and Unarchive Knowledge Bases

It gives the ability to archive Knowledge Bases without deleting them in case you are unsure of their usability.
    1. In the Knowledge Bases Module, archive your Knowledge Bases already created by clicking on the three dots at top right of its panel and then on “Archive”:
It’s also possible to archive a Knowledge Base by quick button as described in paragraphs Settings Knowledge Bases or from the drawer panel as shown in Knowledge Base Drawer Functionality.

Unarchive Knowledge Base

The number of archived Knowledge Bases are displayed at the top left of the current view as described in the paragraph Status Knowledge Bases.
    1. To unarchive a Knowledge Base click on “Archived” at top left of the screen,
    1. From here you can activate again the desired Knowledge Base by clicking on the unarchived icon at top right of its panel:

Delete Knowledge Bases

Note that deleted Knowledge Base will no longer be recoverable. If you are unsure about deleting it, please archive it as described in the Archive and Unarchive Knowledge Base chapter:
    1. In the Knowledge Base Module, delete your Knowledge Base already created by clicking on the three dots at top right of its panel and then on “Delete”:
    1. A pop-up message appears on the screen requesting double confirmation. Click on “Yes” if you are sure to delete the selected Knowledge Base, otherwise click on “No”:
It’s also possible to delete a Knowledge Base by quick button as described in paragraphs Settings Knowledge Bases or from the drawer panel as shown in Knowledge Base Drawer Functionality, or as reported in Delete Knowledge Base from Artifact.

Delete Knowledge Base from Artifact

    1. Inside the Knowledge Base Artifact on any Section, you are also able to delete the Knowledge Base by clicking on “Delete” button on top right of the screen

Status Knowledge Base

    1. In the Knowledge Bases Module at the top left of the current view, a filter is available to display active and archived knowledge bases. In parentheses is the count of Knowledge Base that are in that particular state. By default, the Knowledge Base with “Active” status are shown:
    1. Show only the archived Knowledge Base by clicking on “Archived”:
    1. Show all created Knowledge Base by clicking on “All”:

Sorting and Search Knowledge Base

In the Knowledge Bases Module, sorting and search tools are available.
    1. By default, the “Last Modified” sorting is used but you can select also by “Name” or “Author”:
    1. Furthermore, if you want to search directly for the name of a Knowledge Base then you can do it using the search tool:

Common Challenges and Resolutions on Knowledge Base

Intaking Error

It may happen that for some reason the intaking of documents goes wrong. In these cases a pop-up message appears on the screen reporting the error. Try to solve it and click on “Retry”.
